                            Ready to Proceed?           Register Now        Request Information        Events                                                                  The NYU School of Professional Studies Foreign Languages, Translation, and Interpreting noncredit courses and certificate programs empower you to learn a new language, improve your existing skills, or train for work as an interpreter or translator. We offer a variety of formats and levels in more than 25 languages as well as private instruction and proficiency testing.           Ready to Proceed?        Register for Courses Now                 Noncredit Courses        Noncredit courses are tailored toward your level of expertise, whether you are just learning a language or you are seeking to expand upon your existing knowledge for business or personal enrichment. If you're interested in putting your career on the fast track, consider courses in Chinese, Japanese, Russian, or Arabic, which are becoming increasingly important in business.     Unless otherwise noted, required textbooks are available at the Strand, 828 Broadway at 12th Street.                A Selection of Courses From This Department                                              Arabic: Modern Standard I                                                            Consecutive Interpreting I: Chinese/English                                                            Introduction to Interpreting: Chinese/English                                                            Portuguese to English Legal Translation I                                                            Simultaneous Interpreting I: Chinese/English                                                            Spanish to English Translating for the Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences                                                                               View all Foreign Languages, Translation, and Interpreting Noncredit Courses           Certificates        Courts and hospitals require well-trained, highly specialized interpreters, and the need for translators in government, the corporate world, and the international arena continues to grow. If you’re thinking about a career in interpreting or translation, or you want to become completely immersed in a foreign language, certificate programs allow you to expand your expertise in a flexible format that meets your particular needs.
